text.0: indra hath waxed yet more for hero prowess alone eternal he bestoweth treasures.
text.1: indra transcendeth both the worlds in greatness one half of him equalleth earth and heaven.
text.2: yea mighty i esteem his godlike nature none hindereth what he hath once determined.
text.3: near and afar he spread and set the regions and every day the sun became apparent.
text.4: een now endures thine exploit of the rivers when indra for their floods thou clavest passage.
text.5: like men who sit at meat the mountains settled by thee most wise the regions were made steadfast.
text.6: this is the truth none else is like thee indra no god superior to thee no mortal.
text.7: thou slewest ahi who besieged the waters and lettest loose the streams to hurry seaward.
text.8: indra thou breakest up the floods and portals on all sides and the firmness of the mountain.
text.9: thou art the king of men of all that liveth engendering at once sun heaven and morning.
